caption.p: Genomic alterations and associated disorders in live births.

tr.td: Down syndrome, Triple X syndrome, Klinefelter syndrome, Turner syndrome, Edwards syndrome, Patau syndrome
Chromosomal deletions, insertions, duplications translocations and rearrangements
Whole arm deletions: Jacobsen syndrome, 6q deletion syndrome, Cri-du chat syndrome
Deletion of imprinting genes: Prader-Willi syndrome, Angelman syndrome
Duplications and deletions due to NAHR: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 1A, Gaucher Disease, Hunter syndrome
INDELs: Cystic fibrosis, Fragile X syndrome, Parkinsons disease
Mutations in various DNA damage response and repair genes: Li-fraumeni syndrome, Progeria, Fanconi anemia, Lynch syndrome, Xeroderma pigmentosa, Familial breast cancer, Ataxia telangiectasia
1 in 5000 to less than 1 in 1 million
Schinzel–Giedion syndrome, Kabuki syndrome, Bohring–Opitz syndrome, Proteus syndrome
Isodicentric Y chromosome formation, ring chromosomes
Reciprocal translocations between two different chromosomes
Neurodevelopmental and psychiatric disorders; developmental disorders

fn.p: Abbreviations: INDELs-insertions-deletions; NAHR-non-allelic homologous recombination; CNVs-copy number variants; SNVs-single nucleotide Variants; SV-structural variants.

fn.label: b
fn.p: Indels are < 1 Kbp. Large CNVs examples are larger than 500 Kbp. Examples of genomic disorders are those from live birth.

fn.label: c
fn.p: de novo incidence amongst live births from the NIH National Human Genome database.
